description.p: I was told the atatsu were born from the molten slag of a bleeding mountain, life bursting forth from the cruellest environment imaginable. Others say they bloomed from the first corpses cut down in war, or emerged fully formed from the silent, chill void. There are one hundred stories of how they came to be, but no matter which you choose to believe, in every tale one theme runs true: the atatsu are life born from death.
With gaunt faces, charcoal skin, and coarse crimson petals, Atatsu are a race of sentient plants believed by many to be harbingers of death.

This reputation is not totally unfounded, for atatsu are physiologically sympathetic; their bodies reverberate in harmony with the fleeting spirit of creatures that die in their presence, taking on traits of the deceased for a short time. The slaughter of a mighty beast is felt by its hunters as a surge of physical strength, and the passing of a sage as a transcendent moment of heightened wisdom. As a result, atatsu have a complex relationship with death; to die in their presence is to pass a glimpse of oneself to another, for a short time.

Atatsu’s sympathetic physiology extends to the world around them. While they can briefly share in the physiology of creatures who die, they can permanently take on the physical characteristics of their environment over a longer duration. Humid jungles might impart an atatsu with a permanent scent of rich flora, while icy mountains cause their body to forever be chill to the touch. Atatsu adventurers who travel the world end their lives as a collage of the habitats that succored them, a jigsaw infused with environmental memories ever bonded to their form.

Atatsu are naturally passionate and active. They think, speak, and adapt swiftly, and are known for their fiery tempers and zealous loyalty. With short lives, atatsu see little value in holding grudges or overanalysing a situation, preferring to think on their feet and revel in the heat of each moment. An atatsu’s emotional state can be read on its body: its petals blush darkly when enraged, and the tips of its branches sprout new buds during periods of prolonged grief. It is said that if an atatsu loses a true love, it will forever bloom.

Among the Atatsu, childhood lasts until they affirm their adulthood, a significant milestone that typically occurs after their hundredth year. Prior to this transition, they are referred to by their child names.

Upon reaching adulthood, an Atatsu selects an adult name, although those who have known them since childhood might continue using their child name affectionately. Each adult name among the Atatsu is a unique creation, often drawing inspiration from esteemed individuals or other family members. Gender distinctions are subtle in Atatsu names, and the categories provided here only reflect general trends. Additionally, every Atatsu carries a family name, usually formed by combining various terms from their folklore. While some Atatsu interacting with humans might translate their family names into a more common tongue, others prefer to keep the traditional Atatsu version.

Child Names:Haru, Kyo, Mei, Ren, Sora, Yuki
Male Adult Names:Akio, Daichi, Eiji, Fujio, Hideo, Isamu, Jiro, Kaito, Makoto, Noboru, Raiden, Shinji, Taro, Yasuo
Female Adult Names:Akemi, Chiyo, Emi, Hana, Kaede, Michiko, Natsuki, Rei, Sakura, Tomoe, Yui, Yuri
Family Names (Cultural Significance):Kazekawa (Windriver), Mizuhana (Waterflower), Yamanomori (Mountainforest), Hinotori (Firebird), Tsukinowa (Moonring)
Your atatsu character has a variety of natural abilities.
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Age. Atatsu reach adulthood at the same rate as humans, and go on to live for up to 60 years.
Size. Atatsu vary in size. Your size can be Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Creature Type. You are a Plant.
Gaze Of Death. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

Essence Capture. You have the power to magically capture fragments of a creature’s power when it dies in your proximity. As a reaction when a creature with a CR equal to or lower than your level dies within 10 feet of you, you can capture a fragment of its essence. You gain one of the following effects of your choice:
You replace your Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score with the same ability score of the creature that died.
You gain one special sense of your choice, except truesight, that the creature possessed, out to the same range.
You gain resistance to one damage type of your choice to which the creature had resistance or immunity.
You gain immunity to one condition of your choice, except exhaustion, to which the creature had immunity.
This effect lasts for 1 hour, after which time you return to normal. Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Rugged. Your tough, lignified exterior is a natural barrier to cuts and abrasions. While you aren’t wearing armour, your base Armour Class is 12 + your Constitution modifier.
Fiery Countenance. You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or stunned.

sheet.description: Upon a nearby creature with a CR equal to or lower than your level meeting its demise, you harness its departing essence. Choose from:
sheet.p: Adopting a chosen ability score among Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma from the fallen creature.
Acquiring a specific sensory ability the creature possessed, excluding truesight, up to the same range.
Gaining resistance to a damage type the creature was resistant or immune to.
Gaining immunity to a condition the creature was immune to, except exhaustion.
This attunement lasts an hour, reverting you to your natural state afterward. You must complete a long rest before using this trait again.
